snippet: The Japanese electronics maker is struggling to carry out a long-promised turnaround, with mounting costs from shedding its personal computer business.
abstract: Sony says it had loss of 138 billion yen, or $1.3 billion, in last quarter; forecasts more losses as it struggles to execute long-promised turnaround; company reports loss of 128.4 billion yen for fiscal year that ended in March 2014, about three times its loss of 41.5 billion yen in the previous year.
lead_paragraph: The Japanese electronics maker is struggling to carry out a long-promised turnaround, with mounting costs from shedding its personal computer business.

headline.main: Sony, Hit by a Fresh Annual Loss, Expects Another to Follow
headline.print_headline: $1.3 Billion Quarterly Loss for Sony on Sale of PC Unit
